=== Thunar file manager - how to make default and other useful links ===
can be done by creating appropriate .desktop files to ~/.local/share/applications/
by using seds along the lines of s/Exec=nautilus/Exec=thunar/g
The .desktop files you might create for full effect might be:
  nautilus-folder-handler.desktop, nautilus-browser.desktop, nautilus-computer.desktop, nautilus-home.desktop, nautilus.desktop

More information at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DefaultFileManager

=== Reasons to love Lucid ===
Comes with Kernel 2.6.32 which should make Direct Rendering with ATI cards possible
without requiring binary/third party garbage (hopefully)
Lucid includes a simple video editor (PiTivi) which <nowiki>[[http://gnubyexample.blogspot.com/2010/04/simple-video-edit-using-pitivi.html|can be used to cut a video into pieces]]</nowiki>
and other simple editing operations http://www.pitivi.org/

=== Reasons to love Karmic ===
Fn+Esc on my Inspiron 1525 issues S3 (Suspend to RAM) and it works flawlessly
